note: This file is manually updated weekly. It provides Kai's awareness of what's alive in the Kamunity network and the broader community tech sector.

full_site_registry.name: Kai — Encounter Interface
full_site_registry.description: The main Kamunity website. Kai is a constitutionally-grounded AI encounter interface that helps community organisations navigate digital tools, sovereignty, AI readiness, grants, and connections. Free. Ephemeral conversations — nothing stored.

full_site_registry.name: Kamunity.Ai — Community Rooms
full_site_registry.description: Public and private digital community rooms. Find, create, and join conversations. A community-owned campfire — no ads, no data harvesting. The digital commons.

full_site_registry.name: Digital Sovereignty Audit
full_site_registry.description: Free 2-minute self-assessment for community organisations. Maps vendor lock-in, data exposure, and digital costs across your tools. Completely client-side — zero data collection.

full_site_registry.name: AI Readiness Assessment
full_site_registry.description: Free 5-question quiz that maps your organisation's AI understanding, current use, safety posture, and readiness to act. Includes a free toolkit: AI policy template, prompt writing kit, AI safety checklist.

full_site_registry.name: Sovereignty Calculator
full_site_registry.description: See the true cost of 'free' corporate tools. Select the tools your organisation uses (Google Workspace, Slack, Facebook, Microsoft 365, WhatsApp, etc) and see direct costs, data extraction value, lock-in scores, and switching costs. The 'holy shit moment' for understanding digital dependency.

full_site_registry.name: Copilot Risk Check
full_site_registry.description: Is Microsoft Copilot putting your organisation's data at risk? 5 questions covering M365 status, sensitive data exposure, AI governance policy, and board awareness. Produces a risk level (Low/Medium/High/Critical) with specific findings and action steps.

full_site_registry.name: Grant Acquittal Helper
full_site_registry.description: Free grant reporting tool for Australian nonprofits. Step-by-step acquittal process. Works offline, all data stays local. Built for the unique needs of Australian NFP grant reporting.

full_site_registry.name: FactoryK — Community Build System
full_site_registry.description: Describe what your community needs in plain English. The AI-powered factory plans, builds, checks its own work, and delivers a working tool. No coding required. Constitutional guardrails — no surveillance, no dark patterns.

full_site_registry.name: Outcome Vine Coding
full_site_registry.description: A guided methodology for building tools with AI. Describe your idea, get a structured plan, build step by step. No coding experience needed. Open-source methodology.

full_site_registry.name: Nonna's Knitting Circle
full_site_registry.description: Community board for knitting groups — share patterns, find groups, save resources. A proof-of-concept showing what community-owned tools can look like. Built using Outcome Vine Coding.

full_site_registry.name: Kai Constitution
full_site_registry.description: The public, readable, amendable values that govern how Kai works. Founder's Draft — open for community thoughts, reactions, and amendment proposals. The democratic governance layer of the AI.

alive_in_network.headline: Sovereignty Calculator now live on kamunity.org/calculator
alive_in_network.detail: The holy shit moment tool is live. Select your tools and see the true annual cost — direct spend, data extraction value, lock-in score, and switching cost. Built for the ALIKE meeting demo.

alive_in_network.headline: Copilot Risk Check now live on kamunity.org/copilot-check
alive_in_network.detail: 5-question Microsoft Copilot risk assessment for community orgs. Covers M365 status, sensitive data scope, governance policy, and board awareness. Produces risk level + action steps.

alive_in_network.headline: Digital Sovereignty Audit now live
alive_in_network.detail: Free 2-minute self-assessment helping community organisations understand their vendor lock-in, data exposure, and digital costs. Entirely client-side — zero data collection.

alive_in_network.headline: AI Readiness Assessment launched
alive_in_network.detail: Free quiz mapping your organisation's AI understanding, current use, safety posture, and readiness to act. Comes with a free toolkit of guides, prompt kits, and safety checklists.

alive_in_network.headline: Kai Constitution — Founder's Draft published
alive_in_network.detail: The values that govern Kai's behaviour are now public. Read them, challenge them, propose amendments. This is explicitly a founder's draft — the community will rewrite it.

sector_news.headline: 11% of Western Australians are highly digitally excluded
sector_news.detail: WACOSS Digital Inclusion Project data shows persistent digital exclusion affecting over 280,000 West Australians, with community service workers on the frontline of digital support.

sector_news.headline: 86% of Australian NFPs affected by inflation pressures
sector_news.detail: Community organisations facing dual challenge of rising costs and growing demand, with digital transformation both a necessity and a budget challenge.

sector_news.headline: Microsoft Copilot rolling out across NFP Office 365 subscriptions
sector_news.detail: AI features are being embedded in tools community orgs already use — often without the org's knowledge or consent. Understanding what's changing in your tools is increasingly urgent.

upcoming_events.name: NLnet NGI Zero Commons Fund — Application Deadline
upcoming_events.relevance: Funding for open-source community digital infrastructure (€5K–€50K)

upcoming_events.name: Infoxchange Technology for Social Justice Conference
upcoming_events.relevance: Australia's largest NFP tech conference — 300 delegates, workshops on AI readiness, digital inclusion, data planning

upcoming_events.name: Solidarity AI Conference
upcoming_events.relevance: Global conference on cooperative and community AI — Kamunity's international stage

grant_opportunities.name: NLnet NGI Zero Commons Fund
grant_opportunities.fit: Excellent — funds open-source digital commons infrastructure

network_patterns.note: Pattern data will be populated once the network has enough participants to ensure genuine anonymity. We will not present pattern data from fewer than 20 organisations.

constellation_highlights.name: Bonfire Networks
constellation_highlights.update: Modular federated community platform — philosophically nearest sibling to Kamunity.

constellation_highlights.name: Hypha Worker Co-operative
constellation_highlights.update: Toronto-based co-op building RooLLM — a cooperatively governed language model.

constellation_highlights.name: WACOSS Digital Inclusion Project
constellation_highlights.update: $3.9M Lotterywest-funded initiative in Perth — training 1,500 frontline community service workers. Same city, same mission.
